definition: a tiny lapse can lead to a huge mistake (idiom); a minor discrepancy leading to enormous losses
pinyin: shi1 zhi1 hao2 li2 , cha4 zhi1 qian1 li3

definition: hair/drawing brush/(in the) least/one thousandth/currency unit, 0.1 yuan
Li (c. 2000 BC), sixth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Ai 哀[Ai1]
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
